channel.title: BBC News - Northern Ireland
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Sir Jeffrey Donaldson and Micheál Martin to meet in Dublin
item.description: The DUP leader says the EU needs to "change its tune" on the Northern Ireland Protocol.

item.title: Waiting lists: 53% wait more than a year to see consultant
item.description: More than half of patients waiting for a first consultant appointment in NI wait more than a year.

item.title: BBC NI autumn schedule: What's on television?
item.description: The inspirational story of disabled model Bernadette Hagans is among the highlights.

item.title: Covid-19: NI pupils in contact with coronavirus case can stay in class
item.description: Staff who are fully vaccinated will also not have to self isolate if they are a close contact.

item.title: Stormont payout for institutional abuse victims over data breach
item.description: More than £100,000 is to be paid to 38 institutional abuse victims after their names were leaked.

item.title: Windsor Park to host 16,000 fans for next NI match
item.description: Windsor Park will be at 85% capacity for Northern Ireland's World Cup qualifier against Switzerland on 8 September

item.title: Sinn Féin needed shake up in Foyle, says McDonald
item.description: The party leader visits the Foyle constituency as nominations open to replace the party's MLAs there.

item.title: Ship set for Belfast runs aground on Isle of Man
item.description: A towing company has failed to free a cargo vessel that ran aground near Cranstal.

item.title: Whiteabbey: Boy knocked unconscious in train station attack
item.description: Police said up to 10 young people assaulted the 16-year-old at the railway station on Saturday.

item.title: Afghanistan: Irish emergency mission helps 36 people out of country
item.description: The Irish government says it will continue its effort to help Irish citizens in crisis-hit Kabul.

item.title: Glider: Parties split over route for north Belfast
item.description: Politicians are divided on whether the Glider should go along the Antrim Road or the Shore Road.

item.title: Ireland and France links never been stronger, says Martin after Macron visit
item.description: French President Emmanuel Macron meets the Irish president and the taoiseach on a visit to Dublin.

item.title: Covid-19: Four more deaths and 1,550 new cases in NI
item.description: There are 376 patients with Covid-19 in Northern Ireland's hospitals and 41 patients in ICUs.

item.title: Covid-19: Pandemic had severe impact on young people, says report
item.description: Insufficient consideration was given to the effect on children and young people, says a report.

item.title: High Street voucher scheme to launch after 12 September
item.description: Every adult in Northern Ireland will be eligible for a £100 pre-paid card.

item.title: Covid-19: Samantha Willis' husband speaks of pain of her death
item.description: Josh Willis says he tried to arrange for his wife to hold her newly-born daughter Eviegrace.

item.title: Dr Anne McCloskey: GP suspended over Covid-19 vaccine comments
item.description: Dr Anne McCloskey posted a video on social media claiming vaccines were "damaging" young people.

item.title: Talking points ahead of new Irish Premiership season
item.description: As the Irish Premiership campaign of 2020-21 prepares to kick off this weekend, we examine some of the big points of discussion ahead of the new season.

item.title: Latest Northern Ireland weather forecast
item.description: The weather forecast in Northern Ireland.

item.title: Bracken bashing in the Castlerock countryside
item.description: Environmentalists are trying to help native species and wildlife to thrive in the coastal area

item.title: High pressure driving dry weather in Northern Ireland
item.description: Dry weather is expected over the next seven days, with warm temperatures set to peak on Wednesday.

item.title: Tokyo Paralympics: Meet Northern Ireland's Paralympians
item.description: With the Tokyo Paralympics getting underway a year later than planned, meet the seven Northern Irish athletes ready to compete in Tokyo

item.title: Boris Johnson's Irish Sea tunnel vision - roadworthy or pipe dream?
item.description: A BBC documentary asks how serious is Boris Johnson about a link from Scotland to Northern Ireland?

item.title: NI hospital waiting lists: 'The pain is so bad I have to sit down'
item.description: A woman who needs an ankle operation tells of life on a waiting list while feeling chronic pain.

item.title: Pandemic had severe impact on young people, report says
item.description: A report said "insufficient consideration" was given to how children and young people's lives would be affected.

item.title: Energy prices: gas prices to rise in September
item.description: The Utility Regulator says it could lead to bills going up by about £100.

item.title: Joy Bingham's search for answers in IRA firebomb murder case
item.description: Joy Bingham is searching for answers about why her family's killers got an early release from jail.

item.title: Londonderry: More than 200 parking fines to be refunded
item.description: The Department for Infrastructure admits rule changes were made "without the usual advisory period".

item.title: Afghanistan: Londonderry-based Afghan fears for family
item.description: An Afghan man living in Derry says he has not heard from his family in Kabul for six days.

item.title: Police step up Moygashel patrols after Dungannon Park trouble
item.description: There were reports of a group of masked men patrolling Dungannon Park.

item.title: Tralee: Swimmer rescued after nearly 12 hours at sea
item.description: The man, believed to be from Londonderry, was spotted floating with a pod of dolphins miles from shore.

item.title: Beacon Hospital: School 'did not solicit' Covid vaccines
item.description: The Beacon Hospital in Dublin had administered 20 Covid-19 vaccines to teachers at a private school.

item.title: Afghanistan: Irish citizens wait for rescue mission
item.description: Troops and diplomats are assist more than 30 people who are struggling to get to Kabul airport.

item.title: Irish Army Rangers go to Kabul to help evacuation
item.description: Foreign Minister Simon Coveney says the small team will assist in the evacuation of Irish citizens.

item.title: Galway M6 crash victims were Kurdish family
item.description: The family, which included an eight-month-old baby girl, had been living in Ireland since 2017.

item.title: Galway: Infant and parents among four dead in collision
item.description: Police say four people died at the scene of the three-vehicle collision on the M6.
